elements.title: Resolute desk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jacqueline Kennedy found the Resolute desk (pictured) languishing in the White House basement and had it moved to the Oval Office?

elements.title: Erich Witte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Erich Witte was the first performer of the title role of Britten's Peter Grimes in Berlin?

elements.title: SS Alpena (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the SS Alpena, currently the oldest active steamship on the Great Lakes, was shortened by 120 feet (37 m) in 1991?

elements.title: Expropriate Deutsche Wohnen & Co. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the over 349,000 signatures collected in favour of the Expropriate Deutsche Wohnen & Co. initiative set a new record for the number of signatures collected for a Berlin referendum?

elements.title: Nathan Maguire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that wheelchair racer Nathan Maguire, who is scheduled to compete at the 2020 Summer Paralympics, appeared on a British gameshow with his partner in 2020?

elements.title: Operation Hectic (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Operation Hectic, an operation planned by the Rhodesian security forces to assassinate Robert Mugabe, was called off three hours before it was due to start?

elements.title: Sigismund III (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sigismund III transferred Poland's capital from Kraków to Warsaw in 1596?

elements.title: Nutellagate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the 2013 Nutellagate controversy, students at Columbia University were accused of costing the university $5,000 in dining hall Nutella per week?
